snippet: The Pakistan police said they had made several arrests in the shooting of the teenage education activist Malala Yousafzai, but the Taliban said she would be targeted again.
abstract: Pakistan police say they have made several arrests in the shooting of teenage activist Malala Yousafzai, but the Taliban reiterate their vow to kill her; fate of Yousafzai, who has become a symbol of defiance of the Taliban’s extremist ideology, has gripped Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Sana ul Haq contributed reporting from Mingora, Pakistan, and Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The Pakistan police said they had made several arrests in the shooting of the teenage education activist Malala Yousafzai, but the Taliban said she would be targeted again.

headline.seo: Malala Yousafzai Faces New Taliban Threat
headline.main: Taliban Reiterate Vow to Kill Pakistani Girl
headline.print_headline: Taliban Reiterate Vow to Kill Pakistani Girl
